newsitem.title: USA: Sinter Metals agrees $50 mln credit line.
newsitem.headline: Sinter Metals agrees $50 mln credit line.

text.p: Sinter Metals Inc said on Friday it had formed a new $50 million unsecured revolving credit agreement with Mellon Bank and Key Bank National Association, to support growth and acquisitions.
The terms were similar to a January 1996 agreement, Sinter said in a statement. Mellon would provide $30 million and Key Bank National would provide $20 million, it said.
"The loan will be used in support of the company's general corporate growth and its aggressive acquisition program," Sinter said.
Sinter Metals is involved in the engineering and production of precision pressed metal components.
